title: Fork, ca. 1600–1700
creditline: The Robert L. Metzenberg Collection, gift of Eleanor L. Metzenberg
description: Two long tines, curved shoulders. Spiral-shaped neck, globular-shaped towards the handle. Plain silver ferrule, round in section. Carved ivory handle in the shape of Juno, sister and wife of Zeus. In one hand she is holding a scepter, with the other hand she holds the tip of her veil. A peacock is standing in front of Juno, its tail spread around her legs.

exhibitions.title: Feeding Desire: Design and the Tools of the Table, 1500-2005

tombstone.epitaph:
Fork, ca. 1600–1700.
ca. 1600–1700. steel, silver, ivory. The Robert L. Metzenberg Collection, gift of Eleanor L. Metzenberg. 1985-103-176-c.
